title: Shared Reality - immutable database
description: Disinformation is a grave threat. The public is losing this information war and needs better defenses. We need a trustless source of truth.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would be within the challenge goal, this is a great idea, and I think that this proposal probably will increase utility & adoption of Cardano challenge. At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is explained with a poor example so I suggest to define use cases.
However the objective of the proposal is interesting, but I think it's important to improve details about the solution for the challenge, so it's difficult to assess, because only the context is well written.
f6_assessments.q1:
It's not simple to define if the proposer team states has the necessary experience, because it's clear the experience in general only for the developer, but I don't discover other team members details and professional experience to imagine the project's success. 
The proposer have just developed a beta application, so I think the solution would be completed for the user, but the proposer doesn't describe the blockchain part, IMO the core of the solutions…
The given metrics measure what the proposer wants to do, but the success of his actions is not defined. As mentioned above, the description of the solution is not well explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, how the solution improve their customer experience, and so on…), so the progress of this proposal is not simple to assess.
The metrics for the assessment isn't given, so it's impossible to assess what the proposer wants to do, but the success of his actions is not defined.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestones (incl. time horizon) are weakly described. The budget provided is very general and therefore I cannot say whether it is appropriate or not. There aren't more details how the budget is going to be spent, also I'm trying to discover attachment to deep dive the solution. Furthermore there aren't a lot of information about how blockchain functionalities will be developed and usable for the application users.

f6_assessments.q0: Shared reality is a good cause, however, I failed to understand how the proposal will create and integrate with the Cardano network, I would like the team to provide a deeper explanation about the architecture and language for the implementation of the back end of the product and how this will connect to the Cardano blockchain. For the above reasons, I disagree that the proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the team provided a links to websites, I feel the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. I would like to see links to LinkedIn or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about the team's work history, education and past experiences. I would like the team to expand on the responsibilities and deliverables of each member of the team, this allows insight into whether there is a work overload in one area. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed"
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided a no roadmap and single line budget. I would like to see the team further develop and define monthly Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project– set measurables for performance and use it as a KPI, then connect the KPI to the milestones on the project roadmap. I would like to see the budget developed beyond a single line entrie and broken down into monthly spending and connected to the monthly deliverables. By connecting the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the developer budget, the team can track performance and spending over a timeline. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project might be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is very nice and it is presented with flowery language expressing the importance of such a thing; however this doesn't actually provide information on what they actually want to do other than give information to the public. This is unrealistic to think that if you design the platform the information will come, and if it is edited by community members, it is then no longer objective. As a member of the community trying to disseminate fake news, I appreciate the vision, however from experience it is shown that this is not viable.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has the skills to develop such a website and create a platform. However this does not solve the problem of how the information will be acquired meaning connections should be presented.
f6_assessments.q2: This doesn't really provide ways to assess how successful this proposal is.

solution: A trustless source of truth with a distributed front-end, so everyone can see the same ideas and evidence, and have the same conversation.
experience: I am a web developer, developed the https://SharedReality.solutions platform, and understand the defects in our information ecosystem.
